title: How to Make Butternut Squash Bacon Beer Soup

steps.headline: In a large frying pan, melt the butter over medium heat.
Dice the bacon and cook in a small frying pan until slightly crisp.
Add 3/4 of the cubed butternut squash to the large frying pan.
Pour in the bottle of pumpkin ale.
Stir in cooked bacon (include rendered oil if you like).
Reduce heat and simmer, covered, until squash is soft.
If you don't have a hand blender, puree mixture in a food processor (if you have a hand blender, just continue on until use is stated).
Pour contents into larger soup pot over low heat.
Add water (or chicken stock), paprika, and nutmeg, and parsley.
Dissolve bouillon into the mixture (if you didn't use stock).
Using a hand blender, puree the soup until smooth.
Dice the remaining 1/4 of butternut squash cubes and add to the soup.
Simmer for another 10 minutes and turn off heat.
Serve in bowls garnished with thinly sliced green onions prior to the main course.

text: In a large frying pan, melt the butter over medium heat.  Add diced white onion. Cook until translucent. Dice the bacon and cook in a small frying pan until slightly crisp.  Add 3/4 of the cubed butternut squash to the large frying pan.  Pour in the bottle of pumpkin ale.  Stir in cooked bacon (include rendered oil if you like).  Reduce heat and simmer, covered, until squash is soft.  If you don't have a hand blender, puree mixture in a food processor (if you have a hand blender, just continue on until use is stated).  Pour contents into larger soup pot over low heat.  Add water (or chicken stock), paprika, and nutmeg, and parsley.  Dissolve bouillon into the mixture (if you didn't use stock).  Add the heavy cream.  Simmer for 30 minutes.  Using a hand blender, puree the soup until smooth.  Dice the remaining 1/4 of butternut squash cubes and add to the soup.  Simmer for another 10 minutes and turn off heat.  Serve in bowls garnished with thinly sliced green onions prior to the main course.
